snippet: Syrians, along with other foreigners, were made scapegoats as the military took power and warned of external plots to destabilize Egypt, unleashing a suffocating xenophobia in the news media and on the streets.
abstract: Rising nationalism, xenophobia and economic fears in Egypt have led to attacks on thousands of Syrian refugees who were once welcomed in country when former Pres Mohamed Morsi was in power; as public anger grew against Morsi leading up to his ouster, Syrians have been cast as his allies.

byline.original: By SARAH MOUSA and KAREEM FAHIM

lead_paragraph: Syrians, along with other foreigners, were made scapegoats as the military took power and warned of external plots to destabilize Egypt, unleashing a suffocating xenophobia in the news media and on the streets.

headline.main: In Egypt, a Welcome for Syrian Refugees Turns Bitter
headline.print_headline: In Egypt, a Welcome for Syrian Refugees Turns Bitter

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
